segments.text: We've got a new manager in our department .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh ? You hoped to get that job , didn't you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , I did .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm sorry . That's too bad . Who is it ? Who got the job , I mean ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Someone called Drexler . Carl Drexler . He's been with the company onlytwo years . I've been here longer . And I know more about the job , too
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Hmm . Why do you think they gave it to him and not to you ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Because I'm the wrong sex , of course !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You mean you didn't get the job because you're a woman ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , that was probably it ! It isn't fair .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What sort of clothes does he wear ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: A dark suit . White shirt . A tie . Why ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Perhaps that had something to do with it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You mean you think I didn't get the job because I come to work in jeansand a sweater ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It's possible , isn't it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you really think I should wear different clothes ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well . . . perhaps you should think about it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Why should I wear a skirt ? Or a dress ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I'm not saying you should . I'm saying you should think about it . That's all !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Why should I do that ? I'm good at my job ! That's the only important thing !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Hmm . Perhaps it should be the only important thing . But it isn't . Not in this company .
segments.speaker: S2
